issue.title: Explore & implement options how to show contributors on sktime presence
issue.body:
**Option 1. Paste an image generated by [contrib.rocks](https://contrib.rocks/preview?repo=sktime%2Fsktime)**
PRO: avatars are organised by total amount of contribution, easy to introduce, especially on the .org
con: doesn't show recently active and new contributors, GitHub handles, type of contribution 

**Option 2. Add a [hall-of-fame](https://github.com/sourcerer-io/hall-of-fame) widget** 
PRO: shows recently active and new contributors, GitHub handles
con: doesn't show type of contribution, shows only 7 at a time

**Option 3. Make the [contributors.md](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTORS.md) more visible.**
PRO: shows all contributors in alphabetical order, type of contribution, GitHub handle
con: doesn't show recently active and new contributors

**Option 4. Create a separate sections like on [fastapi page](https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/fastapi-people/)**
PRO: shows contributors in herarchical order, GitHub hanlde, N of PRs, different groups of contributors
con: doesn't show type of contribution, unclear how that list is generated (manually updated?)

My suggestion is to
**_paste the contributors.md generated image on the landing page of sktime.org, and introduce hall-of-fame in GitHub readme._**

issue.title: [DOC] Collection of Documentation issues to get started on!

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
## Welcome to sktime!

Here is a collection of several good "documentation" issues that we are looking for people to take on! 

If you are interested in working on a particular problem we ask that you say so in a comment to avoid the issue of multiple people working on the same problem.

This issue will be updated with more issues/work items through Nov 16th.  We encourage you to check out our [contributing guide](https://www.sktime.org/en/latest/get_involved/contributing.html) and/or ask for help (the contributors channel on slack is also a good place to reach out!) if you get stuck!  [This issue](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues/1147) on good first issues and getting started also has a lot of great suggestions/resources for your first contribution to sktime. 

### Some open issues :
(more will be added)

- [x] #3421
- [ ] #3314
- [ ] #3717
- [ ] #3716
- [x] #2019
- [ ] #3680

[Here is a link](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22documentation%22+) to all open "documentation" issues so that you can check out even more pending issues to work on!

body: Hi, @GuzalBulatova @miraep8. I would like to take up this issue and fix it. Can you just provide me a short guidance on the actual requirements?
Hi, I just got an idea to do this. Instead of marking down all the names. the idea is to use the services from https://contrib.rocks/preview

issue.title: Updated the README.md with the contributors section

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#Description

Adding a separate section for contributors in the readme file. I just found a way to do this efficiently. Instead of marking down all the names, the idea is to use the services from https://contrib.rocks/preview.

##Issue reference
#3717

## Screenshot of the fix

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69035013/210374995-6d8f0942-3b07-4863-881d-0bb5d9a8bf92.png)

## Additional Comments

Clicking the image will redirect you here https://github.com/sktime/sktime/graphs/contributors
And, hovering on the profile image will give you the name of the contributor.
